newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Lion Nathan confirms market share fall.
newsitem.headline: Lion Nathan confirms market share fall.

text.p: Lion Nathan Ltd chief executive Douglas Myers confirmed on Wednesday the brewer's market share had declined in its largest sphere, Australia.
Myers said market share had dropped to 42.0 percent from 43.1 percent in February, as reported in the Australian media. "The figures are accurate," Myers said in an interview.
Myers said he still expected solid profits from Australia but not a lot of profit growth.
But he said the market, not market share, was more of a factor as Australia and New Zealand followed the worldwide trend of declining beer consumption.
"The dynamics of losing a point or a fraction of a point of market share, up or down...is relatively much less worrying to both brewers."
Lion competes against Fosters Brewing Group Ltd in Australia and DB Group Ltd in New Zealand.
Myers said changes in drinking patterns were behind its shift toward cost reduction and diversification into China.
Market share for Lion's Pepsi franchise in Australia was still low but improving.
"Costs are down, market share is up, our actual trading performance has improved and I think we are feeling very much better about the future, but it is a very tough business," he said.
